title: A dialogue betwixt Whig and Tory, ali√†s Williamite and Jacobite Wherein the principles and practices of each party are fairly and impartially stated; that thereby mistakes and prejudices may be removed from amongst us, and all those who prefer English liberty, and Protestant religion, to French slavery and popery, may be inform'd how to choose fit and proper instruments for our preservation in these times of danger.
author: Defoe, Daniel, 1661?-1731, attributed name.
